error.description: If true, the process exited with a exit code not equal 0.

inputs.description: A map of arbitrary strings that is copied into the `outputs` attribute, and accessible directly for interpolation.

kill.description: If set to true, the process will be killed rather than waiting for the process to exit.

outputs.description: After the data source is "read", a copy of the `inputs` map.

process_id.description: A ID of the executed process which is a output of the "start_process" data source.

error.description: True if the last process exited with an exit code not equal 0

fail_on_error.description: If set to true, the resource will fail to create when the process exited an exit code not equal 0

inputs.description: A map of arbitrary strings that is copied into the `outputs` attribute, and accessible directly for interpolation.

outputs.description: After the data source is "read", a copy of the `inputs` map.

retry_interval.description: The number of milliseconds to wait between the tries

stderr.description: The output in stderr of the last process

stdout.description: The output in stdout of the last process

timed_out.description: True if the last process was killed because it took longer than the timeout

timeout.description: The maximum number of milliseconds after the process gets killed, or no timeout if 0

triggers.description: A map of arbitrary strings that, when changed, will force the null resource to be replaced, re-running any associated provisioners.

command.description: The command which will be executed.

interpreter.description: The command line which spawns the process.

platforms.description: The platforms which are valid for this configuration

sensitive_environment.description: A map of environment variables which are sensitive.

stdin.description: When given, this data will be piped into the stdin of the process

stdin_base64.description: When given, this data will be decoded as base64 and be piped into the stdin of the process

working_directory.description: The working directory to start the process in.

block.description: A block which defines a possible command

inputs.description: A map of arbitrary strings that is copied into the `outputs` attribute, and accessible directly for interpolation.

outputs.description: After the data source is "read", a copy of the `inputs` map.

pid.description: The PID (Process Identifier) of the spawned process

process_id.description: A ID of the started process which can be used to end the process with the `end_process` data source.
